content:
hl7-fhircast-bot opened Issue #188

## May 2019 Ballot Comment:

Submitted by Anthony Julian
Chapter/section: Subscription Request
Url: https://fhircast.hl7.org/specification/May2019Ballot/index.html
Type: NEG :exclamation: Clarification
In Person requested: Yes :bust_in_silhouette:

Summary:

Comment: See note on ANSI modal verbs. In the second sentence suggest "will" become "SHALL".

Existing wording: The callback URL MAY contain arbitrary query string parameters (e.g., ?foo=bar&red=fish). Hubs MUST preserve the query string during subscription verification by appending new parameters to the end of the list using the & (ampersand) character to join. When sending the content distribution request, the hub will make a POST request to the callback URL including any query string parameters in the URL portion of the request, not as POST body parameters.
Proposed wording: The callback URL MAY contain arbitrary query string parameters (e.g., ?foo=bar&red=fish). Hubs SHALL preserve the query string during subscription verification by appending new parameters to the end of the list using the & (ampersand) character to join. When sending the content distribution request, the hub SHALL make a POST request to the callback URL including any query string parameters in the URL portion of the request, not as POST body parameters.

_This issue was imported by @hl7-fhircast-bot from the consolidated FHIRcast May 2019 ballot spreadsheet._

hl7-fhircast-bot labeled Issue #188

isaacvetter commented on Issue #188

NOTE on ANSI modal verbs: The usage of ANSI modal verbs consistently provides a vehicle for quickly discerning the conformance criteria.
HL7 adheres to ISO/IEC directive, Appendix G: ANSI modal verbs ("SHALL", "SHOULD", "MAY", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD NOT", "MAY NOT") SHALL be capitalized. See FHIR conformance rules, section 2.1.0.1 "Conformance Language". http://hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/conformance-rules.html

isaacvetter commented on Issue #188

Use SHALL instead of MUST per HL7 FHIR, also chance from "Hub will" to "Hub SHALL".

wmaethner labeled Issue #188
